Uses of Class
camzup.core.Experimental

Packages that use Experimental 
Package Description
camzup.core  
camzup.pfriendly  

  • Uses of Experimental in camzup.core

    Classes in camzup.core with annotations of type Experimental 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  CurveAnim
    Implements a composite piecewise cubic Bezier curve.
    interface  IBlenderWritable
    A package-level interface to generate Blender boiler plate for various entities.
    class  KnotAnim
    Organizes the quaternions that shape a Bezier curve on the surface of a sphere into a sphere coordinate (or anchor point), fore handle (the following control point) and rear handle (the preceding control point).
    class  MeshDirect
    A lower level version of the Mesh class intended for use with JOGL.
    Methods in camzup.core with annotations of type Experimental 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Mesh2 Mesh2.clean()
    Removes elements from the coordinate, texture coordinate and normal arrays of the mesh which are not visited by the face indices.

    Removes elements from the coordinate, texture coordinate and normal arrays of the mesh which are not visited by the face indices.

    Mesh3 Mesh3.subdivFaceCenter​(int faceIdx)

  • Uses of Experimental in camzup.pfriendly

    Classes in camzup.pfriendly with annotations of type Experimental 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  CamEntity2
    An entity which updates a renderer's camera according to its transform.
    class  CamEntity3
    An entity which updates a renderer's camera according to its transform.
    class  MaterialAwt
    A material which supports Images as textures.
    Methods in camzup.pfriendly with annotations of type Experimental 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Up3.beginHud()
    Begins the heads-up display section of the sketch.
    void Yup3.camFlipped()
    Sets the camera to the Processing default, where the origin is in the top left corner of the sketch and the y axis points downward.
    void Zup3.camFlipped()
    Sets the camera to the Processing default, where the origin is in the top left corner of the sketch and the y axis points downward.
    void Up3.endHud()
    Concludes the heads-up display section of the sketch by enabling the depth mask and depth test.
    void Up3.moveByLocal​(float x, float y, float z)
    Moves the renderer's camera by a vector relative to its orientation; causes the camera to orbit around the locus at which it is looking.
    Vec2 Yup2.screen​(Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
    Finds the screen position of a point in the world.

    More efficient than calling PApplet.screenX(float, float, float) , PApplet.screenY(float, float, float) , and PApplet.screenZ(float, float, float) separately.
    Vec2 YupJ2.screen​(Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
    Finds the screen position of a point in the world.
    float YupJ2.screenX​(float x, float y)
    Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the x value for where it will appear on a two-dimensional screen.
    float YupJ2.screenY​(float x, float y)
    Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the y value for where it will appear on a two-dimensional screen.
    void YupJ2.text​(TextEntity2 entity)
    Draws a 2D text entity.

    Support for textures in this renderer is limited.
    static processing.opengl.PShapeOpenGL Convert.toPShape​(processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL rndr, MeshEntity2 source)
    Converts a 2D mesh entity to a PShapeOpenGL.
